definition[0]: to die from being under water for too long, or to kill someone in this way
example[0]: Many people drowned when the boat overturned.
example[1]: Jane was drowned in the river.
example[2]: Depressed, Peter tried to drown himself.
definition[1]: if a loud noise drowns out another sound, it prevents it from being heard
example[3]: A train blew its whistle and drowned his voice.
example[4]: The noise of the battle was drowned out by his aircraftâ€™s engine.
definition[2]: to cover something, especially food, with more liquid than is necessary or nice
example[5]: The fish was drowned in a rich sauce.
definition[3]: to have a very strong feeling or a serious problem that is difficult to deal with
example[6]: Relief agencies are drowning in frustration.
example[7]: The country is drowning in debt.
